newsitem.title: UK: Seton Healthcare down on sales caution.
newsitem.headline: Seton Healthcare down on sales caution.

text.p: Shares in Seton Healthcare Plc plummeted on Tuesday after the healthcare products distributor posted a rise in first-half profits but warned that headline sales growth would slow in the second half of the year.
The stock was down 32p at 488-1/2 by 1230 GMT.

Headline sales would be flatter in the second half, said Seton chairman Norman Stoller, "as the group seeks to increase efficiencies and control stock levels by smoothing its sales pattern more evenly across the financial year."
Stoller said Seton achieved strong sales growth in the first half and expected the underlying trend to remain positive.
Pre-tax profit rose to 7.9 million stg in the first half ended August 31 from 6.1 million a year earlier on turnover which rose to 49.3 million stg from 35.4 million.
The dividend was raised to 2.7p per share from 2.4p.
Seton said it had grown to be the fourth largest supplier of over-the-counter products to UK pharmacies.
